title: iDigital
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Author Geraldine Brooks learned some hard personal-finance lessons when her husband died unexpectedly
items.description: “Memorial Days” is a memoir of grief, but also a practical reminder of the impact of money on anyone’s life.

items.title: It’s Qwen’s summer: new open source Qwen3-235B-A22B-Thinking-2507 tops OpenAI, Gemini reasoning models on key benchmarks
items.description: The new Qwen3-Thinking-2507, as we'll call it for short, now leads or closely trails top-performing models across several major benchmarks.

items.title: EngineAI raises nearly $140M to develop legged, humanoid robots

items.title: Foxglove includes audio support in latest platform update

items.title: AutoNation’s stock rises as higher car prices help it beat sales and profit estimates
items.description: Customers shrugged off higher prices and drove up sales, while AutoNation said it’s well positioned to handle higher tariffs.

items.title: Social Security Administration quietly corrects blog on taxation of benefits — but confusion persists
items.description: Public comments on the agency’s blog show beneficiaries remain confused about the new law.

items.title: Charter is bleeding internet subscribers — and the stock could see its worst day ever
items.description: A downbeat earnings report, plus investor disdain for the pending Cox Communications merger, is sending the stock to a one-year low.

items.title: PayPal’s ‘battleground’ stock heads for longest winning streak in years. Earnings are on deck.
items.description: PayPal’s stock is on track to rise for the eighth session in a row, but analysts have a hard time making a call about the future.

items.title: Anthropic unveils ‘auditing agents’ to test for AI misalignment
items.description: Anthropic developed its auditing agents while testing Claude Opus 4 for alignment issues.

items.title: White House plan signals “open-weight first” era—and enterprises need new guardrails
items.description: Enterprises will not see immediate impact from the AI Action Plan, but it signals wider support for open-source models and evaluations.

items.title: Freed says 20,000 clinicians are using its medical AI transcription ‘scribe,’ but competition is rising fast
items.description: Rather than chase enterprise contracts with large hospital systems, Freed has focused on small clinics and solo practitioners.

items.title: SecurityPal combines AI and experts in Nepal to speed enterprise security questionnaires by 87X or more
items.description: The Kathmandu center of excellence gives SecurityPal a cost base low enough to keep humans in the loop while staying price-competitive.
